intro: Actinophyllum pentandrum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Actinophyllum pentandrum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
